summary.para: Adds a function description to the type description.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the new FUNCDESC in the type information.

param.name: pFuncDesc
param.para: A FUNCDESC structure that describes the function. The bstrIDLInfo field in the FUNCDESC should be null.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: The index specifies the order of the functions within the type information. The first function has an index of zero. If an index is specified that exceeds one less than the number of functions in the type information, an error is returned. Calling this function does not pass ownership of the FUNCDESC structure to ICreateTypeInfo. Therefore, the caller must still de-allocate the FUNCDESC structure.

The passed-in virtual function table (VTBL) field (oVft) of the FUNCDESC is ignored if the TYPEKIND is TKIND_MODULE or if oVft is -1 or 0. This attribute is set when ICreateTypeInfo.LayOut is called. The oVft value is used if the TYPEKIND is TKIND_DISPATCH and a dual interface or if the TYPEKIND is TKIND_INTERFACE. If the oVft is used, it must be a multiple of the sizeof(VOID *) on the machine, otherwise the function fails and E_INVALIDARG is returned as the HRESULT.

The function AddFuncDesc uses the passed-in member identifier (memid) fields within each FUNCDESC for classes with TYPEKIND = TKIND_DISPATCH or TKIND_INTERFACE. If the member IDs are set to MEMBERID_NIL, AddFuncDesc assigns member IDs to the functions. Otherwise, the member ID fields within each FUNCDESC are ignored.
Any HREFTYPE fields in the FUNCDESC structure must have been produced by the same instance of ITypeInfo for which AddFuncDesc is called.
The get and put accessor functions for the same property must have the same dispatch identifier (DISPID).

summary.para: Specifies an inherited interface, or an interface implemented by a component object class (coclass).

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the implementation class to be added. Specifies the order of the type relative to the other type.

param.name: hRefType
param.para: A handle to the referenced type description obtained from the AddRefType description.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: To specify an inherited interface, use index = 0. For a dispinterface with Syntax 2, call ICreateTypeInfo.AddImplType twice, once with index = 0 for the inherited IDispatch and once with index = 1 for the interface that is being wrapped. For a dual interface, call ICreateTypeInfo.AddImplType with index = -1 for the TKIND_INTERFACE type information component of the dual interface.

summary.para: Adds a type description to those referenced by the type description being created.

param.name: pTInfo
param.para: The type description to be referenced.

param.name: phRefType
param.para: The handle that this type description associates with the referenced type information.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: The second parameter returns a pointer to the handle of the added type information. If AddRefTypeInfo has been called previously for the same type information, the index that was returned by the previous call is returned in phRefType. If the referenced type description is in the type library being created, its type information can be obtained by calling IUnknown.QueryInterface(IID_ITypeInfo, ...) on the ICreateTypeInfo interface of that type description.

summary.para: Adds a variable or data member description to the type description.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the variable or data member to be added to the type description.

param.name: pVarDesc
param.para: A pointer to the variable or data member description to be added.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: The index specifies the order of the variables. The first variable has an index of zero. ICreateTypeInfo.AddVarDesc returns an error if the specified index is greater than the number of variables currently in the type information. Calling this function does not pass ownership of the VARDESC structure to ICreateTypeInfo. The instance field (oInst) of the VARDESC structure is ignored. This attribute is set only when ICreateTypeInfo.LayOut is called. Also, the member ID fields within the VARDESCs are ignored unless the TYPEKIND of the class is TKIND_DISPATCH.
Any HREFTYPE fields in the VARDESC structure must have been produced by the same instance of ITypeInfo for which AddVarDesc is called.
AddVarDesc ignores the contents of the idldesc field of the ELEMDESC.

summary.para: Associates a DLL entry point with the function that has the specified index.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the function.

param.name: szDllName
param.para: The name of the DLL that contains the entry point.

param.name: szProcName
param.para: The name of the entry point or an ordinal (if the high word is zero).

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
The element cannot be found.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: If the high word of szProcName is zero, then the low word must contain the ordinal of the entry point; otherwise, szProcName points to the zero-terminated name of the entry point.

summary.para: Assigns VTBL offsets for virtual functions and instance offsets for per-instance data members, and creates the two type descriptions for dual interfaces.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Bound to unrecognized type.
The state of the type library is not valid for this operation.
Type mismatch.
The element cannot be found.
More than one item exists with this name.
The type information is too long.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: LayOut also assigns member ID numbers to the functions and variables, unless the TYPEKIND of the class is TKIND_DISPATCH. Call LayOut after all members of the type information are defined, and before the type library is saved.
Use ICreateTypeLib.SaveAllChanges to save the type information after calling LayOut. Other members of the ICreateTypeInfo interface should not be called after calling LayOut.

Note Different implementations of ICreateTypeLib.SaveAllChanges or other interfaces that create type information are free to assign any member ID numbers, provided that all members (including inherited members), have unique IDs. For examples, see ICreateTypeInfo2.

summary.para: Specifies the data alignment for an item of TYPEKIND=TKIND_RECORD.

param.name: cbAlignment
param.para: Alignment method for the type. A value of 0 indicates alignment on the 64K boundary; 1 indicates no special alignment. For other values, n indicates alignment on byte n.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
The state of the type library is not valid for this operation.

remarks.para: The alignment is the minimum of the natural alignment (for example, byte data on byte boundaries, word data on word boundaries, and so on), and the alignment denoted by cbAlignment.

summary.para: Sets the documentation string displayed by type browsers.

param.name: pStrDoc
param.para: A brief description of the type description.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
The state of the type library is not valid for this operation.

summary.para: Sets the name of a function and the names of its parameters to the specified names.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the function whose function name and parameter names are to be set.

param.name: rgszNames
param.para: An array of pointers to names. The first element is the function name. Subsequent elements are names of parameters.

param.name: cNames
param.para: The number of elements in the rgszNames array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
The element cannot be found.

remarks.para: This method must be used once for each property. The last parameter for put and putref accessor functions is unnamed.

summary.para: Sets the documentation string for the function with the specified index.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the function.

param.name: szDocString
param.para: The documentation string.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
The element cannot be found.

remarks.para: The documentation string is a brief description of the function intended for use by tools such as type browsers. SetFuncDocString only needs to be used once for each property, because all property accessor functions are identified by one name.

summary.para: Sets the Help context ID for the function with the specified index.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the function.

param.name: dwHelpContext
param.para: The Help context ID for the Help topic.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
The element cannot be found.

remarks.para: SetFuncHelpContext only needs to be set once for each property, because all property accessor functions are identified by one name.

summary.para: Sets the globally unique identifier (GUID) associated with the type description.

param.name: guid
param.para: The globally unique ID to be associated with the type description.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: For an interface, this is an interface ID (IID); for a coclass, it is a class ID (CLSID). For information on GUIDs, see Type Libraries and the Object Description Language.

summary.para: Sets the Help context ID of the type information.

param.name: dwHelpContext
param.para: A handle to the Help context.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: Sets the attributes for an implemented or inherited interface of a type.

param.name: index

param.name: implTypeFlags

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: Sets the marshaling opcode string associated with the type description or the function.

param.name: index

param.name: bstrMops
param.para: The marshaling opcode string.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: Sets the type description for which this type description is an alias, if TYPEKIND=TKIND_ALIAS.

param.name: pTDescAlias
param.para: The type description.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Cannot write to the destination.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.
Type mismatch.

remarks.para: To set the type for an alias, call SetTypeDescAlias for a type description whose TYPEKIND is TKIND_ALIAS.

param.name: uTypeFlags

summary.para: Provides the tools for creating and administering the type information defined through the type description.
